item.title: Comment on Bike lanes are not about bikes by Dave
item.description:
Reply to D:

But 20 miles of bike lanes is a tiny amount, no?

What am I missing here

+1

No major American city in 2019 had anything close to a bike network sufficient for a normal person to consider riding. (See Robert Geller's work on Four Types of Cyclists; https://jenniferdill.net/types-of-cyclists/) The books are cooked on US cycling experiments from the get-go. "Look, we did barely anything and it didn't work!"

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/11/bike-lanes-are-not-about-bikes.html?commentID=160837404

item.title: Comment on Bike lanes are not about bikes by Brett
item.description:
Their real value is that they keep bicyclists from biking in the middle of the lanes with cars in them (or on side-walks), and add extra distance between the car lanes and the side-walks.
